attributes.desc: The brother of Thomas Wintour. He joined the conspiracy in 1605.  After the failed plot, he left the Holbeache House before the battle, and evaded capture until January 1606, when he was tried on 27 January 1606, and was hanged, drawn, and quartered a few days later.
Sister of Francis Tresham and wife of Monteagle

Provided funding for the plot; formed a hunting party" to help with a general uprising once the plot went through.""rovided funding for the plot; formed a "hunting party" to help with a gene""ovided funding for the plot; forme"
Brother of John Wright. Involved in the failed Essex Rebellion. Because of his strong family connection to the Wards and Monteagle, he is one of the suspects of the written letter.
Married Christopher Wright, sister of Marmaduke Ward

Fawkes left England in 1593 for Flanders, where he enlisted in the Spanish army. In 1603, he was granted leave to go to Spain on behalf of William Stanley, Hugh Owen, and Father William Baldwin, to get Catholic support from Spain, where he met old friend Christopher Wright. When this effort proved fruitless, he returned and was introduced to Thomas Wintour by Stanley in Brussels. Later that year, Catesby, Fawkes, Thomas Percy, John Wright, and Thomas Wintour met, and Fawkes and Percy agreed under oath to join the other three in the conspiracy. After renting the cellar beneath the Parliament and filling it with hidden barrels of powder, he was sent to Flanders to presumably tell Stanley and Owen the plot. After returning, he given the task of firing the powder. After being captured and tortured, he was excecuted on Friday 31, January 1606.

Married Dorothy Wintour, also involved in Essex Rebellion. Sworn in as a member of the plotters in early 1605, along with Robert Wintour. His role in the plot was to stockpile weapons and horses for the rebellion that would follow the plot, and to kidnap Princess Elizabeth and set her up as the new Catholic monarch.

Close friends with Catesby. Close allies with the Early of Northumberland, by whom he gained the post of Captain of the gentlemen pensioners. He was killed with Catesby at Holbeach after the discovery of the plot.
Earl of Nurthumberland, cousin of Thomas Percy.
Sister of Monteagle and wife of Thomas Habington.
Cousin of Robert Catesby.

Half-brother of Thomas and Robert Wintour. He had no know major connection to the plot, and was only involed unknowingly at the last minute. After the failure, he accompanied the group to Holbeache House, where he decided that he no longer trusted Catesby and the other leaders. Before he could leave, the siege began and he was taken prisoner. He was executed on April 7, 1606.

Leader of the Conspiracy. Grew up in a close-knit catholic community, and became a highly trusted member of it. He was rich, influential, and popular, with both Catholics and Protestants. He was arrested in 1596 because of his known Catholic sumpathies, and was held in the Tower of London along with the Wright brothers and Francis Tresham, and later played a minor role in the Essex rebellion, resulting in a fine. After that rebellion, he joined the Spanish Treason in sending Thomas Wintour and Christopher Wright into Spain to seek millitary and financial assisance. Died at the raid on Holbeache House on November 8th, 1605.

Friends with Catesby, both formed part of the entourage for the Earl of Essex. The third to join the Plot in May 1604, and along with Thomas Wintour, given the job of telling Fawkes the plot. After the failure of the plot, he was killed at the siege at Holbeache House.

Uncle of Stephen Littleton, let him and Robert Wintour stay in his house, but his cook, John Fynwood betrayed the fugitives to the authorities, and Humphrey along with all the servants that assisted in sheltering the fugitives were arrested.
Wealthy man who was recruited later, his wife __was a cousin of Robert Keys.
Half-Sister of Thomas, Robert, and sister of John Wintour, and married to John Grant.

The brother of Robert Wintour. He fought for England in the earlier years of his life, but by 1600 became a devout Catholic. Catesby came to him with the plot, and he decided to join. He traveled to the continent to try and gather Spanish support, but instead met Guy Fawkes and returned to England with him in 1604. After the falied plot on 4 November 1605, he fled with Catesby. He was captured in the fight at Holbeache House, and was tried on 27 January 1606, and was hanged, drawn, and quartered a few days later.
Sister of John Wright and wife of Thomas Percy
Sister of John Wright and wife of Marmaduke Ward of Mulwith,brother of Thomas Ward, servant to William Parker
Brother of Margaret Ward and Thomas Ward, married to Ursula Wright

Friend and cousing by marriage (brother in law) of Francis Tresham. He had ties with extremist Catholic factions during Elizabeth's rule, and organized Thomas Wintour's mission to Spain in 1602, but later reformed when Fames took the throne and promised to follow the state religion. Received the now famous Monteagle Letter on October 26, 1605, which allowed the council to know of the plot.
Servant to William Parker
